tit.cmt: 読み補足、英語の説明を()に

sen.j: 大鎧（おおよろい）は、日本の甲冑・鎧の形式の1つ。
sen.e: Large armor is one of the forms of Japanese armors.
Large armor is one type of Japanese armor.
"Oyoroi" (large armor) is one type of Japanese armor.
sen.cmt: 用語を" "に、英語の説明を()に

sen.j: 馬上で弓を射る騎射戦が主流であった平安 - 鎌倉時代、それに対応すべく騎乗の上級武士が着用した。
sen.e: From Heian Period to Kamakura Period, Wars with shooting bows while riding a horse were the main stream. A riding superior samura wore it.
From theHeian to the Kamakura Period, Wars took place where shooting bows while mounted on a horse was the common method of fighting. A superior mounted samurai wore large armor.
From the Heian to the Kamakura Period, wars took place where shooting bows while mounted on a horse was the common method of fighting and a superior mounted samurai wore large armor.
sen.cmt: スペース補足、削除W小文字にしました。A小文字にしました。and補足。

sen.j: 室町時代ごろには式の鎧、式正の鎧（しきしょうのよろい）と呼ばれた。
sen.e: In Muromachi Period, it was called armor for ceremonyarmor for formal ceremony. In Edo Period, it was called armor for main ceremony.
In the Muromachi Period, it was called armor for formal ceremony. In the Edo Period, it was called armor for the main ceremony.
In the Muromachi Period it was called "Shiki/Shikisho no yoroi" (armor for formal ceremony).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理呼び方の話題のため、日本語読み補足。

sen.j: 江戸時代には本式の鎧と呼ばれた。
sen.e: In the Edo Period it was called "Honshiki no yoroi" (armor for the main ceremony).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: あるいは胴丸や腹巻などと区別して、単に鎧ともいう。
sen.e: Or, it was just only called "armor" in order to distinguish from the "trunk armor" (armor put around the torso) and the belly band, etc.
Or, it was just simply called "armor" in order to distinguish it from "trunk armor" (armor put around the torso) and the belly band, etc.
Or, it was just simply called "yoroi" (armor) in order to distinguish it from trunk armor (armor put around the torso) and the belly band, etc.
sen.cmt: “削除"yoroi"補足、英語説明を括弧に入れました。

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 大陸の騎馬民族の鎧の影響が伺え、挂甲から発展したと考えられている。
sen.e: It was influenced by the armors of the horse riding clans from the Asian continent and was thought to be developed from wearing armors. The production technique of Buddhist altar fittings was used. Thus during Heian Period, it established itself as a peculiar Japanese armor with national cultural style.

It was influenced by the armor of mounted clans from the Asian continent. The production technique for Buddhist altar fittings was used in making armor. Thus during Heian Period, it established itself as a peculiar Japanese armor with a national cultural style.
It was influenced by the armor of mounted clans from the Asian continent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 仏具の制作技法が用いられた。
sen.e: The production technique for Buddhist altar fittings was used in making armor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 平安時代の国風文化の中で日本独特の甲冑として確立した。
sen.e: Thus during the Heian Period, it established itself as a peculiar Japanese armor with a national cultural style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理Heian Period→the Heian Periodに変更しました。

sen.j: 大陸風の挂甲から日本独特の大鎧形式への変化の過程やその正確な時期については、遺品が乏しく明らかでない。
sen.e: Concerning the exact time and the process of change from continent's style of armors to Japan's peculiar style of large armor, the historical items left behind are scarce and not clear. However, it is generally agreed that the basic style roughly established itself around mid Heian Period and during the battles on houses with bows shooting each other. These armors were mainly spread among the superior warriors on horses from Heian Period to Kamakura Period.

Concerning the exact time and the process of change from continent's style of armor to Japan's peculiar style of large armor, historical items left behind are scarce and not clear. However, it is generally agreed that the basic style roughly established itself around mid Heian Period and during the battles on buildings, shooting at each other with bows and arrows. This type of armor were mainly spread among the superior warriors on horses from Heian to the Kamakura Period.
Concerning the exact time and the process of change from continent's style of armor to Japan's peculiar style of large armor, historical items left behind are scarce and not clear.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理’→'

sen.j: おおむね平安時代中期頃にその基本形式が確立したと考えられている。
sen.e: However, it is generally agreed that the basic style roughly established itself around the mid Heian Period and during the battles on buildings, shooting at each other with bows and arrows.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理mid Heian Period →the mid Heian Period に変更しました。

sen.j: 馬上で弓矢を撃ち合う合戦形式が中心であった平安 - 鎌倉時代に主に騎乗の上級武将が着用する鎧として普及した。
sen.e: This type of armor were mainly spread among the superior warriors on horses from the Heian to Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理the削除Heian→the Heianに変更しました。

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)頃に集団戦・接近徒歩戦が盛んになると胴丸・腹巻が多く用いられるようになり大鎧は実戦から姿を消す。
sen.e: Around the time of Nanbokucho Era (South North Dynasty), when the wars became intensified as group and close attacks with walking troops, armors around the torso and belly bands became commonly used, and the large armors disappeared from the actual combats.

Around the time of Nanbokucho Era (South North Dynasty), when the wars became intensified with group and the close attacks of walking troops, armor around the torso and belly bands became commonly used, and the large armor disappeared from the actual combat.

Around the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), when the wars became intensified with group and the close attacks of walking troops, armor around the torso and belly bands became commonly used, and the large armor disappeared from the actual combat.
sen.cmt: the time of Nanbokucho Era (South North Dynasty)→the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan)に変更しました。

sen.j: その後は武将の権威・格式を表す存在となった。
sen.e: Afterwards, the large armor became remaining only to show general's authority and status. In Edo Period, when there was no more disturbance of war, the large armor was symbolically used as a retro armor in the daimyo (feudal lord) family, etc.

Afterwards, the large armor remained only to show a general's authority and status. In the Edo Period, when there was no more war, large armor was symbolically used as a retro armor in the daimyo (feudal lord) family, etc.
Afterwards, the large armor remained only to show a general's authority and status.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 戦乱のなくなった江戸時代には復古調の鎧として大名家などで象徴的に用いられた。
sen.e: In the Edo Period when there was no more war, large armor was symbolically used as a retro armor in the daimyo (feudal lord) family, etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 特徴・構造
sen.e: Features and structure
Features and structure
Features and structure

sen.j: 平安時代の戦闘は一騎駆けの騎馬戦が主であった。
sen.e: During the battles at Heian Period, one general on horse leading the troop was the main style. Basically, a general on horse aim his enemy in his left and shot the arrow.
During the battles in the Heian Period, one general mounted on horseback leading the troops was the main style. Basically, a general on a horse aimed at his arrows at enemies on his left.
During the battles in the Heian Period, one general mounted on horseback leading the troops was the main style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 馬上から敵を左に見て矢を射掛けるのが基本であった。
sen.e: Basically, a general on a horse aimed at his arrows at enemies on his left.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: そのため大鎧は矢の攻撃に対する防御を重視した構造となっており大袖（おおそで）・鳩尾板（きゅうびのいた）・栴檀板（せんだんのいた）等の部品が付属している。
sen.e: Therefore, the large armor was a structure important in defending the attack of an arrow, and the components such as the large sleeve (Osode), the chest plates (Kyubi-no-ita), and the sandalwood plates (Sendan-no-ita) were attachments. The fukikaeshi (left and right flips) of the helmet were also big.

Therefore, large armor was important in defending from arrow strikes, and the components, such as the large sleeve (Osode), the chest plates (Kyubi-no-ita), and the sandalwood plates (Sendan-no-ita) were attachments. The fukikaeshi (left and right flips) of the helmet were also large.

Therefore, large armor was important in defending from arrow strikes, and the components, such as the large sleeve (Osode), the chest plates (Kyubi-no-ita), and the sandalwood plates (Sendan-no-ita) were attachments.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理Attachiments→attached

sen.j: 兜の吹返しも大きい。
sen.e: The fukikaeshi (left and right flips) of the helmet were also large.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 鎧本体は小札（こざね、後述）により形成され、胴部の構造は平面的で広げると一枚の板になる。
sen.e: The armor main body was composed of many pieces of kozane (small plates made of iron and leather), while the trunk was composed of a flat piece of big plate.
The armor main body was composed of many pieces of kozane (small plates made of iron and leather), while the trunk was composed of a big flat plate.
The armor main body was composed of many pieces of kozane (small plates made of iron and leather), while the trunk was composed of a big flat plate.

sen.j: （着用者から見て）正面～左側面～背面までの3面が一続きとなり、空いた右面は脇楯（わいだて）と呼ばれる別部品により覆われる。
sen.e: As seen from a wearer, the front piece, the left side piece, and the back piece are connected as one piece. The missing right side piece is covered with another piece called arm shield (waidate).
As seen from a wearer, the front, the left side, and the back are connected as one piece. The missing right side is covered with another piece called the arm shield (waidate).
As seen from a wearer, the front, the left side, and the back are connected as one piece and the missing right side is covered with another piece called the arm shield (waidate).
sen.cmt: 一文一訳文にするため訂正しました。

sen.j: また背面には逆板（さかいた）をつるし、肩に掛ける肩上（わたがみ）の上には障子の板（しょうじのいた）を垂直に立てる。
sen.e: Moreover, a wooden plate (sakaita) is hanged on the back and a shoji plate is mounted vertically on the shoulder part of armor.
Moreover, a wooden plate (sakaita) is hung on the back and a shoji plate is mounted vertically on the shoulder part of armor.
Moreover, a wooden plate (sakaita) is hung on the back and a shoji plate is mounted vertically on the shoulder part of armor.

sen.j: 胴は絞られておらず、鎧の重量は大部分肩にかかる。
sen.e: The trunk is not tightened such that the weight of the armor is mostly put on the shoulders.
The trunk is not tightened so, the weight of the armor is mostly on the shoulders.
The trunk is not tightened therefore the weight of the armor is mostly on the shoulders.

sen.j: 腰部から大腿部を守る草摺（くさずり）が付属する。
sen.e: Kusazuri (armor for under body) is attached to protect the body part from waist to thighs.
Kusazuri (armor for under body) is attached to protect shield the waist to thighs.
Kusazuri (armor for under body) is attached to protect shield the waist to thighs.

sen.j: 草摺は前後左右の４枚からなり平面的な形状である。
sen.e: Kusasu consists of four flat plates, namely front, back, left and right.
Kusasu consists of four flat plates, namely front, back, left and right.
Kusasu consists of four flat plates, namely front, back, left and right.

sen.j: 大鎧を着て立つと肩で重量を支えることになる。
sen.e: The weight is supported by the shoulders when a person is standing with the large armor on. However, when he is on a horse, the weight of the armor hangs to the saddle and stabilizes the body.
The weight is supported by the shoulders when a person is standing while wearing large armor. However, when he is on a horse, the weight of the armor hangs to the saddle and stabilizes the body.
The weight is supported by the shoulders when a person is standing while wearing large armor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: しかし、馬上では鎧の重量は鞍にかかって安定する。
sen.e: However, when he is on a horse, the weight of the armor hangs to the saddle and stabilizes the body.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 形状も馬上での防御に重点を置いている。
sen.e: The shape also gives priority to defense while the wearer is on horseback. It is armor for battles on horseback who structure is not for walking troops.
The shape also gives priority to defense while the wearer is on horseback. It is armor for battles on horseback and the structure is not suitable for walking troops.
The shape also gives priority to defense while the wearer is on horseback.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: したがって、乗馬戦闘のための鎧で徒歩戦には向かない構造である。
sen.e: It is armor for battles on horseback and the structure is not suitable for walking troops.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 小札（こざね）
sen.e: kozane (small scales made of iron and leather)
kozane (small scales made of iron and leather)
Kozane (small scales made of iron and leather)

sen.j: 大鎧の主体部は小札と呼ばれる鉄製または皮革製の短冊状の小さな板で構成されている。
sen.e: The main part of the large armor is composed of strips (made of iron or leather) called kozane.
The main part of the large armor is composed of strips (made of iron or leather) called kozane.
The main part of the large armor is composed of strips (made of iron or leather) called kozane.

sen.j: 小札には縦に2列または3列の小穴が開けられ、表面には漆が塗られている。
sen.e: Two rows or three rows of small holes of are made along the kozane and Japanese lacquer is painted on the surface.
Two rows or three rows of small holes of are made along the kozane and Japanese lacquer is painted on the surface.
Two rows or three rows of small holes of are made along the kozane and Japanese lacquer is painted on the surface.

sen.j: これを横方向へ少しずつ重ねながら連結した板状のものを、縦方向へ幾段にも繋ぎ合わせる（威す・おどす）ことにより鎧が形成されている。
sen.e: While these are pile up horizontally little by little and connected together. The connected strips are then tied up and joined sideway to form a piece to make the armor.
While these pile up horizontally little by little and connect together. The connected strips are then tied up and joined sideways to form a piece of the armor.
While these pile up horizontally little by little and connect together, the connected strips are then tied up and joined sideways to form a piece of the armor.
sen.cmt: 一文一訳文にするため訂正しました。

sen.j: こうした構成により、着用者の体の屈伸を助ける。
sen.e: With such a structure, the wearer's body can bend and stretch easily.
With such a structure, the wearer's body can bend and stretch easily.
With such a structure, the wearer's body can bend and stretch easily.

sen.j: なお、重量軽減のため、革小札を主体として、要所に適宜鉄小札を混じえる例が多い。
sen.e: In order to reduce the weight, while small leather scales are used as the main body, important positions are protected by properly mixing with small iron scales.
In order to reduce the weight, while small leather scales are used as the main body, vital parts are protected by properly mixing in small iron scales.
In order to reduce the weight, while small leather scales are used as the main body, vital parts are protected by properly mixing in small iron scales.

sen.j: 威毛（おどしげ）
sen.e: odoshige
odoshige
Odoshige

sen.j: 上述の小札を、色糸やなめし革の紐を用いて縦方向に連結することを「威す」といい（「緒通す」がその語源とされている）、連結したものを縅と言う。
sen.e: The above-mentioned small scales are connected vertically with strings and leathers by the process called "odosu (interlace)", while the resulting piece is called "odoshi".
The above-mentioned small scales are connected vertically with string and leather in a process called "odosu (interlacing)," while the resulting piece is called "odoshi".
The above-mentioned small scales are connected vertically with string and leather in a process called 'odosu (interlacing),' while the resulting piece is called 'odoshi.'

sen.j: 小札を繋ぎ合わせる組紐（絲）や韋（かわ）。
sen.e: The small scales (kozane) are interlaced together by thick strings and leathers.
The small scales (kozane) are interlaced together by thick string and leather.
The small scales (kozane) are interlaced together by thick string and leather.

sen.j: 威の色・模様・材質等により紺絲威（こんいとおどし）、匂威（においおどし）、小桜韋黄返威（こざくらがわきがえしおどし）等と呼ばれる。
sen.e: According to the color, pattern design, material quality, etc., the strings are called "Konito-odoshi (lace with navy blue strings)", "Nioi-odoshi (lace with odor)", and "Kozakura Kawa Kigaeshi Odoshi Yoroi (yellow lace with Kozakura leather)". With these, they formed colorful armors of national style.

According to the color, pattern design, material quality, etc., the string is called "Konito-odoshi (lace with navy blue string)," "Nioi-odoshi (lace with odor)," and "Kozakura Kawa Kigaeshi Odoshi Yoroi (yellow lace with Kozakura leather)." With these, they formed colorful armor of national style.

According to the color, pattern design, material quality, the string is called "Konito-odoshi (lace with navy blue string)," "Nioi-odoshi (lace with odor)," and "Kozakura Kawa Kigaeshi Odoshi Yoroi (yellow lace with Kozakura leather)."
sen.cmt: , etc.を削除用語を" "にいれました。”→"一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: これらにより、色彩豊かな国風の鎧が形成された。
sen.e: With these, they formed colorful armor of national style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 絵韋（えがわ）
sen.e: Leather with dyed pattern
Leather with dyed pattern
Leather with dyed pattern

sen.j: 鎧や兜の吹返し表面に張られた皮革。
sen.e: Leather put and mounted on the surface of the armor and left and right flips of helmet.
Leather is mounted on the surface of the armor and on the left and right flips of the helmet.
Leather is mounted on the surface of the armor and on the left and right flips of the helmet.

sen.j: 襷格子柄や獅子、不動明王等の模様が描かれた。
sen.e: It is drawn with patterns such as Tasuki-goshi (cross brace), lion or Acala (God of Fire).
It has patterns such as Tasuki-goshi (cross brace), lion or Acala (God of Fire).
It has patterns such as Tasuki-goshi (cross brace), lion or Acala (God of Fire).

sen.j: 胴前面には弓の弦が鎧に引っかかるのを防ぐ為に弦走韋（つるばしりのかわ）が張られる。
sen.e: To prevent the bowstring of the bow caught to the armor in front of the trunk, a piece of bow leather is put.
To prevent the bowstring getting caught to the armor in front of the trunk, a piece of bow leather is put there.
To prevent the bowstring getting caught to the armor in front of the trunk, a piece of bow leather is put there.

sen.j: 大袖（おおそで）
sen.e: Large sleeve
Large sleeve
Large sleeve

sen.j: 鎧の胴の左右に垂下し、肩から上腕部を防御する楯状の部品。
sen.e: It is a shield-shaped components suspending from right to left along the armor trunk to protect the shoulder to the upper arm part.
It is a shield-shaped component suspended from right to left along the armor trunk to sheild from the shoulder to the upper part of the arm.
It is a shield-shaped component suspended from right to left along the armor trunk to shield from the shoulder to the upper part of the arm.

sen.j: 胴と同様に小札で作られる。
sen.e: It is made with a small scales same as that of the trunk. Usually, it was 6 rows, but it became 7 rows in Kamakura Period.
It is made with small scales, same as that of the trunk. Usually, it was 6 rows, but it became 7 rows during the Kamakura Period.
It is made with small scales, same as that of the trunk.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 通常6段の小札を使用するが、鎌倉時代には7段となった。
sen.e: Usually, it was 6 rows, but it became 7 rows during the Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 飛来する矢を防ぐため、後世の袖に比べ大きい。
sen.e: To prevent arrows that come flying, it is larger than the sleeves of future generations.
To stop arrows, it is larger than the sleeves of future generations of armor.
To stop arrows, it is larger than the sleeves of future generations of armor.

sen.j: 左の袖を射向の袖（いむけのそで）、右の袖を馬手の袖（めてのそで）と呼び、敵対する左の袖の方をより堅牢に作ってある。
sen.e: The left sleeve is called "Imuke-no-Sode (sleeve of shooting direction) while the right sleeve is called "Mete-no-sode (sleeve of horse controlling hand), the left sleeve, which is facing the enemy, is made stronger.

The left sleeve is called "Imuke-no-Sode (sleeve of shooting direction) while the right sleeve is called "Mete-no-sode (sleeve of horse controlling hand), the left sleeve, which is facing the enemy, is made stronger.

The left sleeve is called "Imuke-no-Sode" (sleeve of shooting direction) while the right sleeve is called "Mete-no-sode" (sleeve of horse controlling hand), the left sleeve, which is facing the enemy, is made stronger.

sen.j: 鳩尾板（きゅうびのいた）・栴檀板（せんだんのいた）
sen.e: chest plate, sandalwood plate
chest plate, sandalwood plate
Chest plate, Sandalwood plate
sen.cmt: C、S大文字にしました。スペース削除

sen.j: 弓を射る時に開く脇と胸部を防御する楯状の部品。
sen.e: It is a component to protect the exposed left chest when shooting an arrow with an open arm.
It sheilds the exposed left chest when shooting an arrow with an open arm.
It shields the exposed left chest when shooting an arrow with an open arm.

sen.j: 鎧の胴の前面に垂下する形で付属する。
sen.e: It is attached and suspended in front of the armor trunk.
It is attached and suspended in front of the trunk.
It is attached and suspended in front of the trunk.

sen.j: 右脇が栴檀板、左脇が鳩尾板。
sen.e: The right sideward one is the sandalwood plate, while the left sideward one is the chest plate,
The right side is the sandalwood plate, while the left side is the chest plate,
The right side is the sandalwood plate, while the left side is the chest plate.

sen.j: 右の栴檀板は、弓を引く際に屈伸可能なように小札で構成され、急所に近い鳩尾板は1枚の鉄板とする例が多い。
sen.e: The sandalwood plate on the right is composed of small scales to ease bending and stretching when pulling a bow, while the he chest plate on the left is often made with one more iron plate because it is close to a fatal spot.

The sandalwood plate on the right is composed of small scales to ease bending and stretching when pulling a bow, while the he chest plate on the left is often made with one more iron plate because it is close to a vital spot.

The sandalwood plate on the right is composed of small scales to ease bending and stretching when pulling a bow, while the he chest plate on the left is often made with one more iron plate because it is close to a vital spot.

sen.j: 兜
sen.e: Helmet
Helmet
Kabuto (helmet)
sen.cmt: 補足説明を括弧書きにしました。

sen.j: 星兜・筋兜が大鎧とともに用いられた。
sen.e: Hoshi-kabuto Helmet and muscle helmet were used with a large armor.
Hoshi-kabuto Helmet and muscle helmet were used with a large armor.
Hoshi-kabuto helmet and Suji-kabuto (muscle) helmet were used with a large armor.
sen.cmt: H小文字にしました。筋兜→Suji-kabuto helmet補足説明を括弧書きにしました。

sen.j: いずれも鉄板を張り合わせた兜鉢の裾に、小札で構成した「しころ」（漢字は「革」扁に「毎」）を付ける。
sen.e: Anyway, attached to the iron-plated hem of the helmet is the Shikoro (neck guard).
Anyway, attached to the iron-plated hem of the helmet is the Shikoro (neck guard).
Anyway, attached to the iron-plated hem of the helmet is 'Shikoro' (neck guard).
sen.cmt: the削除原文の「」に合わせ'を補足

sen.j: 大鎧に付属する兜は、顔面の両側を防御する吹返（ふきかえし）が大きく張り出しており、矢に対する防御が図られている。
sen.e: The helmet attached to a large armor has 2 big flips of fukikaeshi to protect the both sides of the face from arrows.
The helmet attached to large armor has 2 big flips of fukikaeshi to protect both sides of the face from arrows.
The helmet attached to large armor has 2 big flips of fukikaeshi to protect both sides of the face from arrows.

sen.j: 草摺（くさずり）
sen.e: Kusazuri (armor for under body)
Kusazuri (armor for the under body)
Kusazuri (armor for the under body)

sen.j: 5段の小札で作られる。
sen.e: It is made with five rows of small scales. Since it may bother on the horseback, the bottom part of the kusazuri in the front and in the back are divided into right and left.
It is made with five rows of small scales. Since it may be cumbersome on horseback, the bottom part of the kusazuri in the front and in the back are divided into right and left.
It is made with five rows of small scales.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 騎乗の際に邪魔になるので前部の前の草摺（まえのくさずり）と後部の引敷の草摺（ひっしきのくさずり）の最下部は左右2つに分かれている。
sen.e: Since it may be cumbersome on horseback, the bottom part of the kusazuri in the front and in the back are divided into right and left.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: またそのためか、前・後が4段で作られた例も少数ながらある。
sen.e: Also probably because of this, it is not uncommon that the front and back kusazuri were made 4 rows.
Also probably because of this, it is not uncommon that the front and back kusazuri were made in 4 rows.
Also probably because of this, it is not uncommon that the front and back kusazuri were made in 4 rows.

sen.j: 左部のものを弓手の草摺（ゆんでのくさずり、「太刀懸の草摺」・「射向の草摺」とも）、右部のものを脇楯の草摺（わいだてのくさずり）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The left one is called "Yunde-no-Kusazuri (lower body armor for shooting arm)", "Tachikake-no-Kusazuri (lower body armor for sword-hanging)" or "Imuke-no-Kusazuri (lower body armor for shooting)", while the right one is called "Waidate-no-Kusazuri (lower body armor for shoulder shield).

The left one is called "Yunde-no-Kusazuri (lower body armor for the shooting arm)," "Tachikake-no-Kusazuri (lower body armor for sword-hanging)" or "Imuke-no-Kusazuri (lower body armor for shooting)," while the right one is called "Waidate-no-Kusazuri (lower body armor for shoulder shield).

The left one is called 'Yunde no Kusazuri' (lower body armor for the shooting arm), 'Tachikake no Kusazuri' (lower body armor for sword-hanging) or 'Imuke no Kusazuri' (lower body armor for shooting), while the right one is called 'Waidate no Kusazuri' (lower body armor for shoulder shield).
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'に-削除

sen.j: 国宝の大鎧
sen.e: National treasures of large armors
National treasures of large armor
National treasures of large armor

sen.j: 製作年代については、研究者や文献により若干の違いがある。
sen.e: Concerning the production age, there are some slight discrepancies in accordance with the researchers and the literature records..
Concerning the age of production, there are some slight discrepancies in accordance with the researchers and the literature records..
Concerning the age of production, there are some slight discrepancies in accordance with the researchers and the literature records.

sen.j: また、「糸」「絲」の表記は便宜上前者に統一した。
sen.e: Moreover, for convenience, the kanji character for "String" is unified as the former simpler one.
Moreover, for convenience, the kanji character for "String" is unified as the former simpler one.
Moreover, for convenience, the kanji characters for "string", '糸' or '絲' are unified as the former simpler one.
sen.cmt: S小文字にしました。表記の説明のため、漢字補足。
